licence.p: Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

list.item: Redistributions of source code must retain the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials provided with the distribution.

licence.p: This software is provided by the copyright holders and contributors "as is" and any express or implied warranties, including, but not limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose are disclaimed. In no event shall the copyright holder or contributors be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, or consequential damages (including, but not limited to, procurement of substitute goods or services; loss of use, data, or profits; or business interruption) however caused and on any theory of liability, whether in contract, strict liability, or tort (including negligence or otherwise) arising in any way out of the use of this software, even if advised of the possibility of such damage.

availability.p: TEI material can be licensed differently depending on the use you intend to make of it. Hence it is made available under both the CC+BY and BSD-2 licences. The CC+BY licence is generally appropriate for usages which treat TEI content as data or documentation. The BSD-2 licence is generally appropriate for usage of TEI content in a software environment. For further information or clarification, please contact the TEI Consortium.

revisionDesc.change: adding the possibility to add BESTOW ref

Changing the @cause ordinal for transposition; changing tei:lem/@cause='transposition' for tei:lem/@type='transposition'; deleting the schematron rule limiting the use of n with p to translations ; deleting a rule regarding the use of @cause transposition on rdg only if there is no lem
Adding a constraint to check for empty witDetail, deleting @type="reformulation" with note and adding @type='retained' on lem
Updating rules related to the new transposition model
Adding the @xml:id for msFrag and msPart
Changing the type of list for @rend hyphen and circle. Adding the value orthographical
adding xml:id for listWit with constraint for listwit with listWit parent and adding hide for app.
adding the values with span for reformulation start and end
Adding choice for the colophon, adding free_octosyllabic value and adding the reformulation for lem. WitDetails rejectec and retained. Adding the value reformulation with note
Changing the context of the constraint for colophon quotes
Allowing script on handNote
Updating the rules for msIdentifier again, adding rules for colophons
Restricting the rules inside ms Identifier and Updating the constraints for HandDesc and its minimal content
Deleting absent_elsewhere type for lem
Adding funder and principal for reused files
Adding the rule for unmetrical; adding the new values for placeName
Correcting some mispelling on @cause for rdg
Adding value unknown for @reason with supplied and @type on note.
Changes the behaviour of g with @type
Adding some attributes and values for dates as well as for rs.
Adding features for translations files
Adding the possiblity to use xml:id on lg and quote
Starting on editing the schema for ms

body.p: Validation Schema to go with DHARMA Encoding guide for Critical Editions

moduleRef.except: abstract appInfo application cRefPattern calendar calendarDesc catDesc catRef category citeData citeStructure classCode classDecl conversion correspAction correspContext correspDesc creation distributor edition extent geoDecl listChange namespace quotation refState refsDecl rendition segmentation seriesStmt sponsor stdVals styleDefDecl tagUsage tagsDecl taxonomy unitDecl unitDef xenoData
alt altGrp annotation joinGrp link linkGrp listAnnotation standOff timeline when

addrLine address analytic biblScope binaryObject cb distinct divGen ellipsis email emph gb graphic headItem headLabel index measureGrp media meeting mentioned milestone noteGrp postBox postCode rb relatedItem rs rt ruby series soCalled street teiCorpus time unit

argument byline closer dateline div1 div2 div3 div4 div5 div6 div7 docAuthor docDate docEdition docImprint docTitle epigraph floatingText group imprimatur opener postscript salute signed titlePage titlePart trailer

addName affiliation age birth bloc climate country death district education event faith floruit genName geo geogFeat geogName langKnowledge langKnown listEvent listNym listObject listOrg listPerson listPlace listRelation location nameLink nationality nym occupation offset org orgName persPronouns personGrp persona population region relation residence sex socecStatus state terrain trait person place
addSpan am damage damageSpan delSpan ex fw handShift line listTranspose metamark mod path redo restore retrace sourceDoc substJoin surface surfaceGrp transpose undo zone facsimile handNotes

accMat acquisition additional additions adminInfo catchwords collation condition custEvent custodialHist depth explicit finalRubric foliation heraldry locusGrp material msItemStruct musicNotation provenance recordHist rubric seal sealDesc secFol signatures stamp surrogates typeDesc typeNote watermark dim dimensions height source support
charName charProp glyph glyphName localName localProp mapping unicodeName unicodeProp unihanProp value

sch:rule.sch:assert: The content of the attribute @corresp should contained ids for both script classification and script maturity, respectively represented by the following prefixes "class:" and "maturity:".

valItem.desc: Jawi script - Narrower concept of Arabic Script

sch:rule.sch:report: @subtype requires @type='component' to be used
seg[@cert='low'] can be used only in a translation file.
seg[@rend='pun'] only available in a translation file.

sch:rule.sch:assert: seg[@rend='highlight'] can only be used as a child of lem or rdg elements.

sch:rule.sch:report: add[@place='overstrike'] should only be used with an element del.

sch:rule.sch:assert: To be encoded a date must contained a year.
@notBefore-custom and @notAfter-custom must be used together
@notBefore and @notAfter must be used together
The attributes @from-custom and @to-custom must be used together

When using a custom attribute such as @when-custom or @notAfter-custom or @notBefore-custom, the attribute @datingMethod is mandatory and should declare the calendar used to convert the dates expressed in those previous attributes.
Only the year in a 4 digits format can be given for the vernacular calendar.

sch:rule.sch:report: gap may have @quantity (a figure) or @extent (a descriptive text value) but not both at the same time.
gap may have @extent only with @unit='character'.
If gap has @quantity then @unit is required
@quantity and @unit can only be used with the values 'lost' and 'illegible' for @reason.
@precision can be use only with @quantity
Only @reason is mandatory in translation with gap
The element gap with @reason='ellipsis' can only be used in translation.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The value used for the attribute @quantity with gap should be a number
hi[@rend='unmetrical'] can only be used within the line verse element l.
The attribute @corresp on a line verse can only be used inside a rdg whose preceding sibling bears @cause='transposition'.
@n is mandatory on every line verse, except when @corresp in used for a transposition.

sch:rule.sch:report: The attribute @n is not allow when the stanza is supplied.
Note(s) should be the last element of the apparatus entry
Note(s) may not contain further notes (this is not a technical requirement but a convention we shall observe to reduce complication)

sch:rule.sch:assert: Note with @type="unknown" can be used only in the parallels list.
An alternative lem should always be the first child after the main lem.
The attribute @rend can only be used with a note for an alternative lem (attribute @type='altLem').

valItem.desc: To be used as the first child to declare a prosodic pattern
To be used only inside the translation
Declares an alternative lemma for display purposes

sch:rule.sch:report: @rend='stanza' can only be used in translations
@n can only be used for paragraphs in translations
The element ptr with the attribute @rend="title" or @rend="siglum" can't be used as a child of bibl.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The colophon should be structured with quote elements
Any quote translating the colophon should be preceded by its equivalent, being a diplomatic or normalized colophon.

sch:assert.test: @key='(caitra or vaisakha or jyaistha or asadha or sravana or bhadrapada or asvina or karttika or margasira or pausa or magha or phalguna)'

sch:rule.sch:assert: with the @type="fortnight", you should used one of the following values: caitra, vaisakha, jyaistha, asadha, sravana, bhadrapada, asvina, karttika, margasira, pausa, magha, phalguna.
with the @type="fortnight", you should used either @subtype="dark" or @subtype="bright".

sch:rule.sch:report: @key shouldn't be used with tei:rs[@type='tithi'], favor @n.

sch:assert.test: @key='(krttika or rohini or mrgasirsa or ardra or punarvasu or pusya or aslesa or magha or purva-phalguni or uttara-phalguni or hasta or citra or svati or visakha or anuradha or jyestha or mula or purva-asadha or uttara-asadha or sravana or dhanistha or satabhisaj or purva-bhadrapada or uttara-bhadrapada or revati or asvini or bharani)'

sch:rule.sch:assert: with the @type="naksatra", you can only used one of the following values for @key: krttika, rohini, mrgasirsa, ardra, punarvasu, pusya, aslesa, magha, purva-phalguni, uttara-phalguni, hasta, citra, svati, visakha, anuradha, jyestha, mula, purva-asadha, uttara-asadha, sravana, dhanistha, satabhisaj, purva-bhadrapada, uttara-bhadrapada, revati, asvini, bharani

sch:assert.test: @key='(tunglai or hariyang or wurukung or paniruan or was or mawulu)'

sch:rule.sch:assert: With the @type='sadvara', you can only use one of the following values: tunglai, hariyang, wurukung, paniruan, was, mawulu.

sch:assert.test: @key='(pahing or pon or wagai or kaliwuan or umanis)'

sch:rule.sch:assert: With the @type='pancavara', you can only use one of the following values: pahing, pon, wagai, kaliwuan, umanis.
With the @type='season', you can only use one of the following values: hemanta, grisma, varsa.

sch:assert.test: @key='(sinta or landep or wukir or kurantil or tolu or gumbreg or warigalit or warigagung or julung or sungsang or galungan or dungulan or kuningan or langki or madasiha or pujut or pahang or kuruwlut or marakih or tambir or madangkungan or mahatal or wuyai or manahil or prangbakat or balamuki or wugu or wayang or kulawu or dukut or watugunung)'

sch:rule.sch:assert: With the @type='wuku' or you can only use one of the following values: sinta or landep or wukir or kurantil or tolu or gumbreg or warigalit or warigagung or julung or sungsang or galungan or dungulan or kuningan or langki or madasiha or pujut or pahang or kuruwlut or marakih or tambir or madangkungan or mahatal or wuyai or manahil or prangbakat or balamuki or wugu or wayang or kulawu or dukut or watugunung.

sch:assert.test: @key='(rat or buffalo-ox or tiger or hare-cat or dragon or snake or horse or goat or monkey or cock or dog or pig)'

sch:rule.sch:assert: With the @type='chinese', you can only use one of the following values: rat, buffalo-ox, tiger, hare-cat, dragon, snake, horse, goat, monkey, cock, dog, pig.
With the @type='solstice', you can only use one of the following values: winter or summer.
With the @type='equinox', you can only use one of the following values: autumn or spring.
With the @type='eclipse', you can only use one of the following values: lunar or solar.
Sic in choice can only be used for colophon

sch:rule.sch:report: The attribute @corresp can't be used with the attribute @type='edition'.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The attribute @corresp is mandatory if your file is a translation, a commentary or a bibliography.

sch:rule.sch:report: The attribute @n can't be used on div if its child its an ab element with the @type 'invocation' or 'colophon'.
the attribute @n can't be used on a div with @type='interpolation'.
@n forbidden on div if it contains invocation or colophon
The supplied @reason='explanation or subaudible' can only be used in translations

sch:rule.sch:assert: The element lem is mandatory within an app entry, except for the transposition

sch:rule.sch:report: An element app, inside the parallels list, can only have the attribute @type with the values 'imitation' or 'adaptation'.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The attribute @hand can only be used on lem with the attribute @varSeq or the following sibling witDetail.
sch:rule.sch:report: The attribute @varSeq and the element witDetail can't be used together. You should choose only one of the two solutions to express the ante and post correctionem process.
No @wit should be given on a lem with @type
An element lem containing an embedded apparatus entry should have an attribute @type or @wit

sch:rule.sch:assert: @xml:id is mandatory on the listWit of a family
The attribute @hand can only be used on rdg with the attribute @varSeq or the following sibling witDetail.
sch:rule.sch:report: The attribute @varSeq and the element witDetail can't be used together. You should choose only one of the two solutions to express the ante and post correctionem process.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The only value allowed with @cause for a rdg containing a span[@type='omissionStart'] or span[@type='omissionEnd'] is 'eyeskip'.
The content of the witDetail's @wit attribute must also be declared as @wit of the preceding sibling.
sch:rule.sch:report: WitDetail should be an empty element

sch:rule.sch:assert: Project members prefix is part:
Choice can only be used in the element colophon in the critical editions

sch:rule.sch:report: Choice can contained only maximum 3 unclear elements

sch:rule.sch:assert: HandDesc should contained at least one paragraph or one handNote element
The msIdentifier should contain settlement, when not associated with msFrag.
If repository is given, msIdentifier should an idno
The handDesc is mandatory.
For @type="region", the @subtype should be one of the following values: @subtype='district' or @subtype='province' or @subtype='country' or @subtype='land'
For @type="settlement", the @subtype should be one of the following values: @subtype='town' or @subtype='village' or @subtype='hamlet' or @subtype='armyCamp'
For @type="builtPlace", the @subtype should be one of the following values: @subtype='temple' or @subtype='monastery' or @subtype='feedingHall' or @subtype='tank' or @subtype='pavillion'
For @type="cultivation", the @subtype should be one of the following values: @subtype='garden' or @subtype='cave' or @subtype='road' or @subtype='canal' or @subtype='field' or @subtype='orchard'

sch:assert.test: @subtype='forest' or @subtype='wood' or @subtype='grove' or @subtype='tree' or @subtype='river' or @subtype='pond' or @subtype='mountain'

sch:rule.sch:assert: For @type="naturalPlace", the @subtype should be one of the following values: @subtype='forest' or @subtype='wood' or @subtype='grove' or @subtype='tree' or @subtype='river' or @subtype='pond' or @subtype='mountain'

sch:rule.sch:report: Locus[@type='displacement'] can only be used as a child of rdg.

sch:rule.sch:assert: The atrributes @from and @to must be used together.
Corr in choice can only be used for colophon
Corr should be used in choice
Orig in choice can only be used for colophon
Orig should be used in choice
Reg in choice can only be used for colophon
Reg should be used in choice
